1.title: The Sheepdogs/Nikki Yanofsky/Walk Off the Earth/Classified
1.plot: In the premiere episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, the Sheepdogs travel to Sun Studio in Memphis to record an exclusive cover of Elvis Presley's "Hound Dog." Frontman Ewan Currie channels the king with the help of some modern effects and a little inspiration from Jerry Lee Lewis and Johnny Cash. Hollywood's legendary Quincy Jones introduces Backstage Pass to his pop/jazz protégé, Nikki Yanofsky. We travel to Hollywood, CA, to the Capitol Studios to crash a session in the renowned Studio A. YouTube sensation Walk Off the Earth perform their song "Red Hands" in our ...

2.title: Of Monsters and Men/City and Color/Hey Ocean/Arkells
2.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Iceland's OF MONSTERS AND MEN perform "King and Lionheart" at the inaugural CBCmusic.ca Festival. The band headlined the 1-day concert on a cool Spring evening in Toronto ON. Before hitting the stage Nanna and the boys tell us a little about their idea of good 'festival ethics'. DALLAS GREEN talks exclusively to BSP about recording "Hurry and The Harm" in Nashville and making new music with his band CITY AND COLOUR. The band then hit the stage for a HOCKEY NIGHT IN CANADA pre-game concert to a sea of Maple Leaf blue. HEY ...

3.title: Sam Roberts/Kathleen Edwards/Matt Mays/White Horse
3.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, CBC radio's Grant Lawrence crosses the country in a VW Beetle. On his latest stop, Grant visits 'La Belle Province': Quebec. SAM ROBERTS performs 'Without A Map' on the sidewalk of Old Montreal to a very small and intimate audience. KATHLEEN EDWARDS gives CBC Music Backstage Pass a fun and off-the-cuff tour the CBC Music Festival mess-hall. Then the Ottawa songstress performs 'Change the sheets' live from the Echo Beach main stage. MATT MAYS performs his fan favourite 'Loveless' from Toronto's smoke infused Studio 211. And ...

4.title: Chris Hadfield & BNL/Metric/Stella Sisters/Shred Kelly
4.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, commander CHRIS HADFIELD and BARENAKED LADIES front man ED ROBERTSON meet up and plan the first ever song to be recorded in space. CBC Music Backstage Pass camera's are invited to Toronto's Studio 211 to eavesdrop on what is a legendary recording in the making. METRIC perform 'Breathing Underwater' to an audience of several thousand on the steps of Ottawa's parliament buildings. The Canada Day celebration ends in an explosion of fireworks and fanfare. Backstage Pass travels to Nashville to meet the darling STELLA SISTERS. ...

5.title: The Sheepdogs Memphis Special
5.plot: In this special episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, The Sheepdogs travel to Memphis Tennessee to record four songs at the legendary Sun Studio. The Sheepdogs front man Ewan Currie visits Graceland and talks a little about how 'The King' made it cool to emote while still being 'a man'. Ewan invites BSP to his favourite Memphis dive and watering hole to explain a bit of his creative process and the energy found in the city that Elvis Presley first recorded. The band visits GUS's in Memphis for deep-fried chicken and pickles meal before heading back to the studio to ...

6.title: Serena Ryder/Great Big Sea/Corb Lund/Elliot Brood
6.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Serena Ryder performs her hit song 'Stompa' with the support of Broken Social Scene's Kevin Drew. The Canadian songstress gave an exclusive listening party at Toronto's ultra-cool MOD Club, and CBC Music cameras were there. Alberta's Corb Lund reveals his passion for knot-tying before hitting the stage at the inaugural CBC Music festival to sing 'Bible on the Dash'. The son-of-a-rancher proves why he is an authentic cowboy. Great Big Sea talks about a sad maritime song with a great hook. Alan Doyle also explains the irony ...

7.title: KRNFX/Hannah Georgas/The Deep Dark Woods/Metric
7.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, vocal percussionist Terry 'KRNFX' Im teaches CBC Music the intricate art of beat-boxing. Terry then re-imagines 'O Canada' with the help of Maiko Watson and a digital sampling machine. It is a rendition of the National Anthem like none you've heard before. Hannah Georgas performs 'Robotic' in a moody Vancouver Studio. With the lights cut, we let the room fill with music and haunting projections on the walls. Saskatoon's The Deep Dark Woods drop into CBC studio 211 to perform their new single '18th of December'. The ...

8.title: Blue rodeo/Kings Of Leon/Emm Gryner/Biff Naked
8.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Blue Rodeo makes the trek to Greg Keelor's farm house in the country, the place where they recorded their latest LP In Our Nature. The band performs their new single 'New Morning Sun' from that album. Grammy award-winning Kings Of Leon takes the stage in Montreal to kick off the NHL season. Caleb, Nathan, Jared and Matthew perform 'Supersoaker' accompanied by a spectacular sound and light show. Emm Gryner drops into Toronto Studio 211 to sing 'Ciao Monday'. And Bif Naked invites Backstage Pass into a very personal and ...

9.title: Eastcoast Anthem/Randy Bachman/Zeus/Whitehorse
9.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass the CBC MUSIC ALL-STAR CHOIR sing 'Put Your Hand In The Hand'. At the 2013 East Coast Music Awards CBC Music gathered an all-star line-up to pay tribute to one of the maritimes' most endeared songs. See how many performers you can name. Legendary THE GUESS WHO guitarist RANDY BACHMAN shares a little knowledge on the "10 guitars that changed music forever". The Harmony Danelectro guitar is the first installment of the exclusive 10-part series. ZEUS drops into Toronto Studio 211 to perform "Are you gonna waste my time?" ...

10.title: Hedley Quietest.Concert.Ever Special
10.plot: In this special episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Hedley performs CBC Music's 'Quietest.Concert.Ever' in Banff National Park. Eleven hundred lucky fans experience something extraordinary as the BC boys perform never heard before cuts from their new album 'Wild Life'. Jacob, Dave, Chris and Tommy take Backstage Pass on a personal guided tour of Canada's first National Park. They visit famed Johnston Canyon and the historic Cave and Basin before Jake and Dave strip down for a dip in the Banff Hot Springs . Jacob also shares the five elements that make Hedley who they...

11.title: Sloan/Randy Bachman/Brett Kissel/USS
11.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Sloan's Chris Murphy talks a little "hardcore" while backstage at the 2013 CBC Music Festival. The band later hits the stage to perform a fan favourite, "Money City Maniacs." Legendary Guess Who guitarist Randy Bachman talks about the Fender Stratocaster in his second installment of The 10 Guitars That Changed Music Forever. In this episode, Bachman shares a little knowledge and a couple memorable riffs played on this iconic guitar. Country music freshman Brett Kissel shares a little background on the writing of his radio ...

12.title: Blue Rodeo Farmhouse Sessions Special
12.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Blue Rodeo invites BSP to Greg Keelor's home just outside Peterborough, Ont. The Canadian Music Hall of Famers grant Backstage Pass and you exclusive access to their country farmhouse studio: the birthplace of their latest LP, In Our Nature. Keelor gives Backstage Pass a guided tour of the 150-year-old farmhouse and studio. This is where 1993's Five Days in July was recorded.

13.title: Juno Rockers & NHL Greats/Passenger/Half Moon Run
13.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Juno Award nominated musicians and NHL greats join in an unforgettable "Life is a highway" locker room sing along. On Juno Awards weekend 2013, the Moose Jaw Warriors loaned their rink out to some seasoned veterans of the NHL and some vets and rookies from the Canadian music scene. After the game, the players pay tribute to a Canadian pop icon. Scroll to the bottom of this post to see the entire list of performers. Also, Passenger busks on a Vancouver sidewalk to the delight of unsuspecting passers by. The Brit-folk rocker ...

14.title: Holiday Special
14.plot: In this very special holiday episode, CBC Music Backstage Pass compiles five recordings from our 12 Days of Christmas series. Enjoy an uninterrupted playlist tonight. YouTube sensation Walk Off the Earth kicks off the show by reimagining "Little Drummer Boy" with their unique flavour and love for drums. Toronto's own USS rock "Jingle Bells" with the help of a turntable guitar. Pianist Michael Kaeshammer shares memories of holidays past before playing a seasonal favourite, "Winter Wonderland." Royal Wood recalls the Christmas he got his beloved red wagon. The singer ...

15.title: Hedley/Corb Lund/Great Big Sea/Elliott Brood
15.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Hedley performs 'Mexico' at CBC Music's Quietest.Concert.Ever. Alberta's Corb Lund reveals his passion for knot-tying before hitting the stage at the inaugural CBC Music festival to sing 'Bible on the Dash'. The son-of-a-rancher proves why he is an authentic cowboy. Great Big Sea talks about a sad maritime song with a great hook. Alan Doyle also explains the irony surrounding 'Excursion around the bay': a tragic tune that is often sung in foot-stomping celebration. And Elliot BROOD performs 'Northern Air' in an exclusive ...

16.title: Lights/Bobby Bazini/Joel Plaskett Emergency
16.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Lights travels to the Inuvik in the northern territories to celebrate the return of the sun. Bobby Bazini performs two songs in Montreal's famed snow village. And Joel Plaskett grants BSP uncharted access to the making of the hit song "Lightning Bolt".

17.title: Gryphon Trio/Kings of Leon/Hey Ocean!/Sarah McLachla
17.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass CBC Radio 2's Tom Allen takes us on a music journey through the annals of time. On a late night in 2013, Tom Allen asked the question "Where did social media all start?" He follows five of the most recognizable notes in pop culture, through 6 centuries of classical music. Grammy award winning band Kings Of Leon have been rocking arena sized crowds for half a decade. The band takes the stage in Montreal to perform 'Use Somebody'. Backstage Pass was there to record it. Hey Ocean performs their song "I am a heart" in Vancouver ...

18.title: Lights in Inuvik Special
18.plot: In this special episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Lights travels beyond the arctic circle to greet the returning sun. The electro-pop singer performs 4 exclusive tracks from her 2013 album "Siberia Acoustic". In 2013 CBC Music Invited Lights to pack her bags and head north to perform a show at Inuvik's beautiful Igloo church. To open the show she plays an acoustic rendition of "Toes". But first she and CBC music lace up for a uniquely arctic past time. Lights talks about the beauty and geographic diversity of Canada while standing on the tarmac of Inuvik's only ...

19.title: City and Colour/Lennon and Maisy/The Good Ol Goats
19.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass City and Colour performs before a sea of blue and white hockey fans in Toronto's ACC square. Dallas Green and the boys perform 'Fragile Bird': a song that charted #1 on the Canadian Alternative Rock list for 9 weeks. YouTube sweethearts Lennon and Maisy Stella perform from the 'Mother Church of Country Music' in Nashville, TN. In 2013 the sisters sat down with CBC Music to try something different: an original tune. The Stella Sisters debut a new original song 'Bright Side'. In the summer of 2013 CBC Radio 3's Grant Lawrence ...

20.title: Sam Roberts Band/Rik Emmett (Of Triumph)/Mother Mother
20.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Sam Roberts Band previews a new song from the unreleased 'Lo-Fantasy' album. CBC Music opened the doors to Toronto Studio 211 so 30 lucky fans could experience what it is like to jam with their favourite band. Here's what happened. Famed guitarist Rik Emmett (of Triumph) gives BSP a fun lesson on 'How to play guitar solos". In this short 'how-to' Emmett shares a little insight on one of the dying art forms of the rock-n-roll live show. And Mother Mother, one of the west coast's fave indie bands, performs two songs from ...

21.title: Sam Roberts Band 'Lo-Fantasy' Special
21.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, Sam Roberts Band performs four new songs from the just-released Lo-Fantasy album. CBC Music opened up the doors to Toronto Studio 211 so that 30 lucky fans could experience what it's like to sit in on a jam with their favourite band.

22.title: Dan Mangan "What Happens Next" Special
22.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass, BSP profiles Vancouver singer-songwriter Dan Mangan. The night before Mangan played the biggest concert of his life, he invited a few close friends over for a poker game and explored the ideas of fate, destiny and the daunting question: what happens next?

23.title: Belle Starr/Brett Kissel/Johnny Reid
23.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass we go country. Belle Starr performs three of their favourite Canadian country classics. Brett Kissel sings "Raise Your Glass" with just an acoustic guitar and a vintage CBC microphone. And Johnny Reid performs "Fire it up" in Toronto Studio 211.

24.title: The Sheepdogs/F'd Up/PS I Love You
24.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Sheepdogs perform 2 songs from the roof of CBC Toronto. Hardcore band F'd Up celebrate the 35th anniversary of Toronto's infamous 'Last Pogo'. And PS I Love You go hard and heavy singing "Dont Go".

25.title: Blue Rodeo/Aidan Knight/Royal Wood & Sarah Slean
25.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Blue Rodeo celebrates 25 years of making music with a few of their closest musical friends. Aidan Knight hits the stage at the 2013 CBC Music Festival. But before plugging in, he teaches us the secrets of good festival merch shopping. And Royal Wood teams up with Sarah Slean to perform 'The Glory" in Toronto Studio 211.

26.title: F'd Up 'The Last Pogo' Special
26.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Canadian punk rock heroes F'd Up pay tribute to the bands that paved the way for hardcore in Canada. The Last Pogo has gone down in music history as one of the most important gigs in Punk Rock. The cops showed up, a riot broke out and punk rock history was made. F'd Up perform four tunes from that fateful night.

27.title: Pete Rock/Ghostkeeper/Hayden/Hawksley Workman
27.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass legendary producer Pete Rock hooks up with rappers Rich Kidd and Raz Fresco to record a live version of his classic, "They Reminisce Over You." Alberta's Ghostkeeper plays a tune in a Calgary shop window. Hayden drops into Toronto Studio 211 to perform 2 fan favourites "Blurry Nights" and "Should Have Been Watching You". And Grant Lawrence makes another stop on his cross-Canada Beetle roadtrip to visit Hawksley Workman in Ottawa.

28.title: Down with Webster/Hedley/Classified & David Myles
28.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Down With Webster rocks two brand new songs off the floor in Toronto Studio 211. Hedley performs 'Crazy For You' at CBC Music's Quietest.Concert.Ever in Banff National Park. And Classified teams up with wingman David Myles to perform "So Blind" in Halifax.

29.title: Hannah Georgas & Ryan Guldemond/Randy Bachman/Mo Kenney
29.plot: In this episode of CBC Music Backstage Pass Hannah Georgas and Ryan Guldemond perform two songs at the CBC 'Love Motel' in Vancouver. Famed Guess Who guitarist Randy Bachman showcases the Gibson L5 one of the '10 Guitars that changed music forever'. And Mo Kenney and Joel Plaskett drop by Toronto Studio 211 to perform "Sucker".

30.title: Royal Wood/Tom Allen/Hannah Epperson
30.plot: In this episode of Backstage Pass Royal Wood performs 2 songs for CBC Music First Play Live. CBC Radio 2's Tom Allen takes us on a journey through musical history. And Hannah Epperson re-imagines a Stompin' Tom classic "Sudbury Saturday Night" in a pared down 'single-shot' performance.
